Package com.intellij.codeInsight.highlighting

Interface CodeBlockSupportHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCodeBlockSupportHandler

    public interface CodeBlockSupportHandler
    Provides information about complex language structures, like multi-block expressions (if/elsif/else/end).

    Used to:

    • highlight markers or keywords if one of them is under cursor
    • navigate to the begin/end of the block
    See Also:
    AbstractCodeBlockSupportHandler, BraceMatcher, CodeBlockProvider

    • Field Detail

      • EP

        static final LanguageExtension<CodeBlockSupportHandler> EP

    • Method Detail

      • getCodeBlockMarkerRanges

        java.util.List<TextRange> getCodeBlockMarkerRanges(PsiElement elementAtCursor)
        Checks if code block marker (or keyword) is under cursor and collects related markers: e.g. finds if/elsif/else if cursor is on the else from this compound statement.
        Returns:
        List of ranges of related structural markers or empty list if there is no structural marker under cursor or it should not be handled (highlighted) for any reason.

      • getCodeBlockRange

        TextRange getCodeBlockRange(PsiElement elementAtCursor)
        Checks if cursor is inside the block supported by this handler.
        Returns:
        range of the smallest code block cursor is in or empty range if not in code block.

      • findCodeBlockRange

        static TextRange findCodeBlockRange(Editor editor,
                                    PsiFile psiFile)
        Attempts to find code block range using extension points.

      • findMarkersRanges

        static java.util.List<TextRange> findMarkersRanges(PsiElement markerPsiElement)
        Returns:
        ranges of markers to highlight iff markerPsiElement is one of these markers.

      • findMarkersRanges

        static java.util.List<TextRange> findMarkersRanges(PsiFile psiFile,
                                                   Language language,
                                                   int offset)
        Parameters:
        language - language helps to use a proper psi subtree in case of multi-root psi trees
        Returns:
        ranges of markers to highlight iff there is a marker in psiFile at offset.
        See Also:
        findMarkersRanges(PsiElement)
